metadata.titel_preek: A Question Out Of The Darkness

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from doubt and 'grip-slipping' in the darkness of suffering to a renewed confidence in God's providence through the observation of His past and present record.

tekstueel_bewijs: What is one to do then? What can one do?
He decided to put the matter before the Master.
Look around now and you will see... in your life signs that God is at work.
What is one to do then?
What have I to ask beside?

zender.identificatie: The Experience of Suffering/The Human Condition
tekstueel_bewijs: night of despair closes in upon us
he will make it serve his purpose and our good.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: Tell him to make his decision upon the basis of my record.
consider how it has been with us in the past
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily a 'Helper' or 'Defendant' providing evidence to the Subject.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as the internal feeling of despair resulting from external 'routine of quiet desperation' rather than cosmic sin or death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: John the Baptist's historical doubt and Jesus' response.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: John the Baptist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: John's story serves as an exemplar for the hearer's current psychological state.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Human Suffering → Evidence of Mercy → The Troubled Soul
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Hearer → Maintaining the 'Grip' of Faith

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pleads, but always with the note of one who is in command.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: What is one to do then?
A person can lose one's faith in the darkness if he or she is not careful.
You and I may have cried out ever so desperately.

voorbeelden: we ought to try to brace ourselves
we ought to consider how it has been with us
He decided to put the matter before the Master.
If a soul must doubt... let him first feel...
Tell John what you have seen and heard.
look around now and you will see

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes that if the hearer 'knows' or 'remembers' God's past record, they will have the 'power' to hold on. It is a cognitive-therapeutic approach.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Movement from S1 (Initial faith) to ~S1 (Doubt) to S2 (Despair), then attempting to reach S1 again via ~S2 (Evidence).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the Subject's decision to 'look around' and 'remember' rather than a new act of God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a psychological threat to the individual's well-being rather than a theological state of alienation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses high Christological language, the 'engine' is anthropocentric. God is the object of our investigation and the helper of our faith-maintenance, rather than the primary actor who delivers from the darkness.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: A person can lose one's faith in the darkness if he or she is not careful and prayerful.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will accept whatever it is we truly have to lift up before him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is used as a model for how the hearer should handle their own doubt.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Jesus as the one who fulfills the signs of the kingdom despite the 'darkness' of the prison, regardless of John's ability to 'hold on'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Places the burden of 'holding on' (the grip) on the hearer's willpower and memory.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is reduced to the maintenance of a psychological state of trust.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from John's story to the hearer's life is smooth but shifts the focus from God's objective action to the hearer's subjective perception.
spanning_punten: Jesus says 'the dead are raised' (objective power), but the preacher tells the hearer to 'feel the warming sun' (subjective comfort).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Tell him to make his decision upon the basis of my record.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer must muster their own 'vouloir' (will) to look at the evidence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is treated as 'losing one's grip' or 'doubting' rather than an ontological condition.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'call to remember' where the Hearer is the Subject and God's past actions are the Helper. The Object is the restoration of the Hearer's faith.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'brace' themselves and 'not let the grip slip'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who holds the hearer, rather than the hearer holding Jesus.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'My grip nearly slipped,' use 'When my grip slipped, His hand held me fast.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero who must decide based on the record.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Poor' to whom the Gospel is preached (Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the passive verbs in the Luke text (lepers are cleansed, dead are raised).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Savoir (Knowing the record) and Devoir (We ought to consider).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir (God's power to raise the dead).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the same power that raised the dead is currently operating in the 'darkness' regardless of the hearer's 'grip'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present the 'darkness' as a power that only the 'He that should come' can conquer.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'bad feelings', the Savior is just a 'good memory'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (our response) has swallowed the 'Primary Program' (God's deliverance).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ comes to the prison (Soteriology). 2. We lament and look to Him (Ethics/Response).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and empathetic, but structurally places the weight of salvation on the hearer's cognitive ability to remember God's goodness.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is comforting; actantially, it is demanding (it requires the hearer to perform the 'looking').
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Messianic signs of Isaiah; Greimas shows these signs are used here as 'evidence' for a human jury.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that God has been moved from 'Subject' (the one who acts) to 'Helper' (the one who provides evidence for the human Subject).

volledige_subject_lijst: God will not be put on trial
You and I may have cried
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Axis of Transmission' (Sender to Receiver) but misidentifies the Sender as the human experience of suffering rather than the Divine Mandate.
